content: Which Nobel Prize-winning author wrote the novels "One Hundred Years of Solitude" and "Love in the Time of Cholera"?

The Nobel Prize-winning author who wrote both "One Hundred Years of Solitude" and "Love in the Time of Cholera" is Gabriel García Márquez. He was a Colombian novelist, short-story writer, screenwriter, and journalist, known for his works of fiction that blended magical realism with historical and political themes. García Márquez won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1982, recognizing his profound impact on contemporary literature. His writing is celebrated for its rich imagery, complex characters, and innovative narrative techniques that have influenced generations of writers around the world.
